attributes.action: Give parents the right to make an audio recording with social workers
attributes.background: I wanted an audio recording of a meeting with social services as I have a disability which makes it difficult to take notes and affects my memory. I also felt under stress and worried that things I have said or others have said might not be recorded accurately. I wasn’t allowed to record it.
attributes.additional_details: I informed them in writing I would record the whole meeting & it would not be edited. I would send an unedited copy of the recording to the other people at the meeting. Also the recording was for my own use, for any court proceedings or taking legal advice. I would not distribute it on the internet. This is allowed under the Data Protection 1997 Act, Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000 & the Human Rights Act Article 10. There is no law saying I need their permission. I am not a data controller so I am not bound by the act.

attributes.action: Make photo ID mandatory in all elections and Referenda.
attributes.background: We believe production of photo ID in all future elections and Referenda should be mandatory. There have been several examples of personation in elections. Bringing in mandatory photo ID when voting would remove this problem.

attributes.action: To retract the £1bn DUP deal and use the money across the whole United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Conservative Party promised £1bn to Northern Ireland as part of a deal to secure a majority government with the Democratic Unionist Party. This deal should be suspended and the £1bn should be spent  across the whole of the UK, not to prop up a Parliamentary majority.

attributes.action: Force the legal separation of ticketing companies from ticket resale companies.
attributes.background:
The ticketing companies have no interest in selling all tickets at original face value as they will inflate their profits by selling them through their related businesses.
"Sold out" tickets appear on resale sites within minutes of release for several times the face value.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing ticketing companies to own related companies which can resell tickets at a higher price has an inherent conflict.

attributes.action: End the benefits freeze
attributes.background: The freeze of working age benefits will take almost £1 billion from the pockets of people living in Scotland by 2020/21. People across Scotland are affected by the freeze and by ending it we will improve both our society and the economy by putting money in people’s pockets.
attributes.additional_details:
Keeping the cash value of benefits the same while costs are rising is pushing people into poverty. The freeze on working age benefits will affect around 750,000 households by the end of the decade.
Reversing the freeze could help lift people out of poverty and prevent others from falling into poverty. Research from CPAG shows that reversing the freeze to even just the child element of tax credits and child benefit could keep up to 400,000 children across the UK from falling into poverty.

attributes.action: Outlaw the excessive noise levels that are associated with fireworks.
attributes.background: The explosions that are part of many firework displays are uncomfortably loud to humans and are very often terrifying to animals who suffer as a result.The bangs are not a necessary part of the display and the spectacle would not suffer if loud bangs were not part of it.

attributes.action: Drastically improve funding for mental health services
attributes.background: I have personally experienced the impact of the cuts to mental health services when I needed the help the most and I know I am not the only one who has experienced this: child or adult. There needs to be far more funding and support from the Government, but more importantly the Minister of Health.
attributes.additional_details: One in four people will experience or may have already experienced mental health problems. The Government really need to start helping those in need and support those that are in need of help. Increased funding to mental health services will drastically reduce the waiting time children, adolescents and adults have to wait to begin counselling and therapy.

attributes.action: Raise a Brain Aneurysm Awareness campaign
attributes.background: I recently lost my sister to a ruptured brain aneurysm. After numerous visits to doctors and hospitals for over a month. Not one of them even suspected this despite having all the symptoms of brain aneurysm.
attributes.additional_details:
One doctor suggested applying a hot water bottle to her head!!!
AWARENESS IS NEEDED.

attributes.action: Allow the collection of store points when purchasing stage one infant formula.
attributes.background:
You are unable to earn Boots Advantage Card points, Tesco Clubcard or Nectar points when buying stage one baby milk, as it is perceived to discourage breastfeeding. 
I believe this law should be changed so that families who can't or chose not to breastfeed their children are not being penalised.
attributes.additional_details: The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula Regulation 2007 prohibits the promotion of formula feeding & this includes allowing families to earn points for buying stage one formula, points can also not be used to buy formula. Points are available when purchasing items relating to breastfeeding (breast pumps/ pads etc). Therefore I believe it to be discriminatory against those who can't or don't want to breastfeed their children that points cannot be collected against stage one formula.

attributes.action: Mandatory bike helmets for ALL cyclists, on ALL bikes on ALL terrains
attributes.background: A friend on his bike was hit by a car. He was lucky, he could have died but he HAD a helmet on which saved his life. People are not so lucky if they’re not wearing a helmet.
attributes.additional_details:
The Consultant in Neurosciences Intensive Care, Wessex Neurological Centre, "It is my job .... to not only save lives but try to make those lives worth living. Cycle helmets offer vital protection to one’s fragile skull and can save lives and significantly reduce damage to the brain in the event of an impact. If every cyclist wore a helmet the number of cyclists killed or seriously injured each year would be reduced."

http://www.headwayoxford.org.uk/cyclehelmets/ (17 July 2017)

attributes.action: include The Baha'i Faith as part of the Religious Studies Syllabus in Schools.
attributes.background:
The Baha'i Faith is the world's youngest religion. It is only 173 years old.

It brings all other major religions together and is based on Unity of Mankind.

It makes sense! and can potentially save a lot of conflicts in the world.
attributes.additional_details:
www.bahai.org

There are over 6 million Baha'is in the world and the interesting concept is that they come from all sorts of backgrounds.

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed
attributes.background: To grant the right for people in rented accommodation who are struggling with emotional distress, depression – to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.
attributes.additional_details: Please visit: http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Stop kids under 16 buying all energy drinks
attributes.background: Energy drinks are full of caffeine - no wonder kids have bad attitudes and are hyped all the time. They're pumped up on caffeine.

attributes.action: Smear tests for women every year to prevent cervical cancer.
attributes.background: Would like to see the smear tests for women every year to prevent cervical cancer, not every three years. Because more and more young mums with cervical cancer are dying each year and the quicker it's detected the better chance of survival.

attributes.action: Keep the iconic burgundy British passport
attributes.background: The government has stated its intention to change UK passports from red to blue. This needless colour change would bring no benefits. Since no under-40 ever possessed a blue passport, a change would mean little except to a shrinking minority. To young people, the red passport is the iconic one.
attributes.additional_details:
Changing the colour would be a backwards step for a country that seeks, in the words of the Prime Minister, to be a forward-looking nation with a 'dynamic, creative spirit'.

It is also unclear why, since we are exiting the EU, we would want to change passports from the current patriotic red to the colours of the EU flag. Since EU member states are allowed any colour of passport they like, changing would be no great statement of sovereignty, as some have suggested.

While frivolous petitions are quite rightfully rejected, passport colour is of serious concern to many around the country. As the Immigration Minister says: “One of the most iconic things about being British is having a British passport.” I trust, therefore, that this petition will be treated with the seriousness it merits.

attributes.action: Amend driving licences to remove the unnecessary title from women's licences.
attributes.background: UK driving licences betray a clear and unwarranted gender bias. Men's driving licences are in their name without a title: John Smith. Women's driving licences contain a title: Miss Joan Smith. There is no reason for this. Someone's marital or academic status has no impact on their ability to drive.

attributes.action: Lift the UK Travel Ban to Sharm el Sheikh
attributes.background: The UK remains one of the only countries in Europe to still have a travel ban to Sharm. This should now be lifted. Egypt has a 'high' terror threat, along with other countries such as Australia, France, Thailand etc. British holiday makers are still able to travel to these countries.
attributes.additional_details: The Egypt officials have done everything the British government has asked of them. They have spent over £20 million on security (hiring British security firms). The British public are still travelling to Sharm el Sheikh by joining connecting flights from Germany, France as well as Cairo . Most European countries have now lifted their travel ban, except for the UK. This ban is damaging the UK and Egypt tourism industry, the government lift the ban to Tunisia after sousse attack, so why not Sharm.

attributes.action: Paediatric mental health training within the NHS medical staff
attributes.background: The issue is that the paediatric medical staff (NHS) doesn't know how to deal with mental health at all when a child is admitted to the ward for observation, with mental health training the staff  would be able to provide a better duty of care. (See additional details for a personal story)
attributes.additional_details:
Backround:
The reason for this petition is that my child has multiple mental illnesses and has been hospitalised as a result of this 5 times in 2017, when at the emergency department a lot of the staff was unsure what to do, they just sent the child up to the paediatric ward to be in overnight until CAMHS would arrive. However in all instances the staff was unsure what to do.

attributes.action: Raise the Minimum Wage for under 25s and apprentices
attributes.background: The Government's National Living Wage does not apply to those under the age of 25, who can be paid as little as £3.50 per hour if they are an apprentice or £4.05 otherwise.
attributes.additional_details:
It is an absolute scandal that this Tory government is forcing younger across the UK to live on poverty pay by refusing to give under 25s the basic protection of the National Living Wage.

This is an issue of fairness and equality. If you do the same job you should be paid at the same rate regardless of your age, and everyone should be paid at least the living wage so that they have enough money to feed themselves and cover the basics, like their rent and bills.

attributes.action: Cyclist should be subjected to a CBT type training prior to using the highways.
attributes.background: Many cycle deaths are a result of improper road knowledge of cyclists. Cyclist, like scooter riders should be subjected to a basic compulsory training session to use the public highways. This will generate revenue for the government as well as reduce cycle fatalities.
attributes.additional_details: I am a cyclist and have completed training with my local authority. I was amazed to learn how much at risk we are when we make small mistakes e.g. Speeding, not indicating or being on the wrong lane or even, when we overtake other cyclists.

attributes.action: Smart Brexit:  Apply to rejoin EFTA
attributes.background: A 'hard Brexit' is a nightmare scenario for the UK, in which jobs and trade will suffer catastrophically. However, the U.K. can maintain free trade with the EU by applying to European Free Trade Association (EFTA) Council to rejoin EFTA and regain powers to write trade deals with non EU countries.
attributes.additional_details: The EFTA countries enjoy unparalleled access to EU goods and services markets. EFTA citizens enjoy free movement across EEA/EU states. EFTA States have 27 free trade agreements, covering 38 countries including Canada, and are close to signing an FTA with India. In addition, EFTA is outside the EU foreign, justice, agriculture and fisheries policies. Overall, reductions in net cost to the UK have been estimated at between 17% and 60% of current payments.

attributes.action: Protect pregnant air crew or trying to conceive from flying to zika countries
attributes.background: Regardless of all the government warnings about travelling to a zika destination when pregnant or trying to conceive, employers are forcing cabin crew, pilots or their partners to fly there risking the life and health of their unborn. We need a specific law to protect to people trying to conceive.
attributes.additional_details: All the information on the public health, government and centre for disease control and prevention all state that if you are trying to conceive or your partner is pregnant, you should not travel to zika destinations regardless of the risk level. If you are male it states that you can pass this on to your partner whether pregnant or not. The laws must also apply to partners. Airlines are forcing crew and pilots to continue flying risking the lives and health of their unborn.

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave from 2 weeks to at least 4
attributes.background: 2 weeks is not enough time to help with the mother and bond with the baby. 4 weeks should easily be the minimum to give dad's a better chance to bond and give the mother more support.
attributes.additional_details:
Men suffer from postnatal depression too. I did, and I went sick for 4 weeks. Having these extra weeks helped me bond with the baby instead of never seeing her due to work. Here's my story:

https://youtu.be/mt-yyjEotE0

This is something that benefits both the mother and the father, and is incredibly important for bonding in the early stages of a babies life.

attributes.action: For All prisons in the Uk to become 'Autism friendly'
attributes.background: There is very little training in prisons for officers/ staff to recognise and support Autistic adults  entering the prison and  serving  their sentence. Only one prison in the UK called Feltham, has been Autism accredited and has made such a huge impact on supporting Autistic prisoners .

attributes.action: Construct a bypass around Chideock, Dorset to relieve the traffic problems.
attributes.background:
A bypass is needed to divert the A35 trunk road away from the centre of this ancient village and improve the environment and road safety in the area.
Traffic delays potentially harm the much needed economic benefits of local tourism.
attributes.additional_details:
There are safety issues caused by the volume of traffic. Source for traffic volumes: David Peacock for Dorset CPRE (London Inn traffic 1986-2016)
There are health hazards arising from the traffic pollution. Source for air quality: www.dorsetforyou.gov.uk/airquality/chideock
The village contains 63 listed buildings and deserves proper conservation. Source for listed buildings: www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk

attributes.action: Make cervical scans compulsory for anyone that has received cervical treatment
attributes.background: In Feb 2012 I underwent a LLETZ procedure to remove CIN 2 pre-cancerous cells from my cervix. When I fell pregnant in October 2014 I had an appointment with a medical registrar who advised there would be no effect on my pregnancy. In March 2015 my waters broke at 24 weeks & my son passed away.
attributes.additional_details:
At the time nobody was aware of what had caused my waters to break as I had received no monitoring during my pregnancy. Had I received cervical scans like I did in my subsequent pregnancy they would have been able to diagnose me with Incompetent Cervix & put a stitch in to save my son. 

Due to the amount of cells that were removed I was deemed to be 'low risk'. So if a low risk patient can lose a child then anybody can and this is totally unnecessary heartbreak that could have been prevented.

attributes.action: No more ofsted and introduce peer review instead
attributes.background: Ofsted is fundamentally flawed and is incredibly expensive. Teachers and leaders spend hours getting evidence ready for them rather than considering the best teaching approach. Each inspector comes with their own ideas and teaching can be subjective. Schools publishing peer reviews would be better.

attributes.action: Lower the age restriction on smear tests to allow women under 25 to be eligible.
attributes.background:
- Sexual activity is legal from the age of 16, therefore so should smear tests
- Some women go for their first smear test at 25 & are having some sort of minor procedure which could have been resolved years prior. 
- Our health doesn’t have a start date for complications, it can happen at any age!
attributes.additional_details:
Below is reference of a case where a woman wasn’t taken seriously on her symptoms.

If your old enough to engage in sexual activity; your old enough to be taken seriously with any health symptoms & concerns you may have. 

The cervical cancer injection is powerless on its own, however with the age of the smear tests being lowered I think it would be effective. 

http://metro.co.uk/2015/07/24/this-21-year-old-mum-has-just-two-years-to-live-after-being-denied-a-smear-test-5310462/

attributes.action: Parliament to debate accountability & efficacy of Sharia Councils under UK law.
attributes.background: Sharia law varies in interpretation within Islam but tends to be male dominated and discriminates against vulnerable women who may not be aware of their rights under civil law, Parliament to consider any legal incompatibilities between Sharia and UK law and how vulnerable women can be protected.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament are aware of concerns that Sharia Councils may make different judgements after civil courts have made their judgements and vulnerable women may feel peer pressure to comply with theocratic law. We pride ourselves on equality and one law for all, regardless of gender or religion but in practice all women do not access it.

attributes.action: Change ethnicity classification of people of African & Caribbean descent in UK.
attributes.background:
I believe Africans and Caribbeans should not be referred to as Black British with a focus on the word "Black".

The right term should be either African British or Caribbean British just like we have Asian British etc.
attributes.additional_details: The word 'Black' has a negative connotation to it and should be removed from any reference made to and about Africans or Caribbeans.

attributes.action: Stop police and crime commissioners from controlling the fire brigade.
attributes.background: The Police and Crime Act 2017 gave the police and crime commissioner the ability to apply to the Home Secretary to take democratic control of a county fire service. We the undersigned ask that this power be repealed as undemocratic. Firefighters should be represented by local councillors.
attributes.additional_details: One police and crime commissioner cannot adequately represent an entire county fire service. When a decision of this type is made it is decided on economics alone. This fails to consider factors such as whether firefighters have been consulted on potential changes to their duties. Many such applications are made with a clear desire to merge Police and fire services. This would mean a drastic change in job role without any debate or consultation at the local council.

attributes.action: Save the Borough of Poole.
attributes.background: We object to the proposed Future Dorset merger of Poole with adjacent councils. The public consultation was entirely flawed and Poole council's vote approving the merger was too narrowly based for such a sudden, profound and unnecessary reform. The residents of Poole do not want this merger.
attributes.additional_details:
The public consultation of 2016 was undebated, poorly advertised, designed simply to yield support for the plan and supported by analysis containing egregious errors.
The council decision showed a lack of unanimity for the abolision of a centuries-old borough. It was was not supported by any opposition councillors while the ruling group worked unreasonably to prevent any dissent within its own ranks.
The financial reasons used to justify the merger are erroneous and grossly misleading.

attributes.action: Petition for annual increase for pensioners outside the EU Block.
attributes.background: My pension has been deferred for 5 years, by various Governments and now I find, I will not get yearly pension rises, because I am not in an EU country!

attributes.action: End homelessness in Britain by adopting and funding the "Housing First" project.
attributes.background: There are over 9000 homeless people living on the streets of Britain. Many are ex military men and women suffering from mental health issues. No one chooses to be homeless. Britain can and should eradicate homelessness. The "Housing First" model has already proven to reduce homelessness in Europe.
attributes.additional_details: Finland adopted the "Housing First" model in 2008. To date Finland is the only European country to see homelessness numbers falling. The model is simple: Provide a home first, treat the causes of homelessness and help people to retrain and get back into work and reintegrate into society. Not only is "Housing First" cost effective but it is morally the "right thing to do". Many MP's already support "Housing First". By supporting this petition you could force a parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: Give all drink and drug drivers automatic 10 year ban
attributes.background: My mother was left in a pool of blood on the pavement because someone choose to drink and drive , He then left the scene with 3 other people in the car with no remorse , I was 12 years old standing over my mother with no one around , Nothing has changed in the 37 years she was killed ,
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are losing their lives due to drunk and drug drivers , The punishment in the UK is to weak with most willing to take the chance " why is this " no one fears the punishment , It is time to make people think hard about what will happen and the consequences of their actions .

10 year ban on the first offence with no appeal .

attributes.action: Allow UK university students to have free prescriptions and dental care
attributes.background: U.K. Students do not currently receive free prescriptions and dental care. Whilst at university many students struggle with money and forego taking medication and dental checks as they cannot afford it. Allow students to have this at no cost to ensure they're receiving the treatment they need.

attributes.action: Zero hours contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices.
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: The Government to take the UK out of the ECJ & end free movement in March 2019
attributes.background: The government have been given a mandate by the people of the UK. If we have not left the jurisdiction of the ECJ after March 2019 then we have not left the EU. We also mandated you to stop free movement. If not enforced correctly, this would be a denial of the peoples democratic vote.

attributes.action: Educate children early on the dangers in and around open water/ cold water shock
attributes.background: I lost my son Cameron to cold water shock in July 2015 something we as a family knew nothing about , he was 14 fit, healthy and had his whole life ahead of him. I truly believe that had he had the educate on the real dangers in and around open water he'd still be here today
attributes.additional_details: Deaths in open water is a a leading cause of accidental death in the UK. More often it's the dangers unknown to many ie cold water shock and the deadly effects it has on the human body that leads to a loss of life rather than the swimming ability of the individual. Education is key to reduce the numbers of lives lost  Swimming and classroom lessons should teach children about the dangers of cold water shock new figures show a 25 per cent rise in the number of young people drowning accidentally

attributes.action: Lower the cervical smear test age to 18!
attributes.background: We want to lower the age of smear tests from 25 to 18. If we cannot lower it to 18 we should at least let girls from 18 be allowed to get a test if they so wish!
attributes.additional_details: Every 2 in 100 girls that are diagnosed are under the age of 25. If there is history in the family of cervical cancer I believe girls should be allowed to be tested and not have to wait until they are 25! Please see sense! Sign this petition so that we may help others and potentially our children or our children's children in the future!

attributes.action: Provide statutory anonymity for victims of homophobic & transphobic hate crime.
attributes.background: Being 'outed' is a barrier for victims to LGB&T hate crime reporting an incident to the Police and later attending court. Introducing statutory anonymity, as already given to victims of serious sexual assault, would remove this barrier, as well as removing the possibility of hostile media reporting.
attributes.additional_details:
1. LGB & T Hate Crime Reporting: Identifying Barriers and Solution, Equality Human Rights Commission (2015), page 31.
2. The Hate Crime Report: Homophobia, biphobia and transphobia in the UK, GALOP (2016), pages 8 - 9.
3. Homophobic Hate Crime: the Gay British Crime Survey (2013) pages 18 - 19.

attributes.action: Drop the ban on 22lr target pistols
attributes.background: The ban on 22lr target pistols restricts shooters from doing the sport in England Scotland and Wales

attributes.action: Give mothers and fathers 50/50 custody of children in separation or divorce.
attributes.background: Fathers are just as important to the health development of children. Often limiting a father's access affects a child more than is realised creating societal and mental health issues for the child later in life. Don't make children decide between parents but have a balanced upbringing.
attributes.additional_details: Currently men generally only receive every other weekend in the courts and many use their children as a weapon to hurt fathers, when in fact children are being hurt. Men are considered second class citizens with mothers stating fathers must "win their children over" when mums have to make no effort. Children are used to inflict pain on another part and its not fair on the child to be in this position and having to take sides. I propose to give equal access and go to court for more as in the USA.

attributes.action: Stop the Mersey Gateway tolls
attributes.background: The Mersey Gateway crossing is due to open imminently. Users of the crossing who reside outside of Halton will have to pay for the use of this crossing. This is unfair and unjust. All other toll routes in the UK have a viable alternative. This one doesn't.
attributes.additional_details: Halton Council and the Mersey Gateway Project claim the crossing will bring prosperity to Halton. These claims are unfounded. Effectively the only thing the crossing will achieve is the alienation of Liverpool, St Helens, Warrington and the surrounding area. The new crossing will only carry around 50% of the traffic of the old crossing as people will find alternative routes. Once Warrington becomes busier will the Government then toll there. Where does tolling end?

attributes.action: Allow Premier League and Championship football clubs to introduce safe standing
attributes.background: Safe Standing offers a much safer alternative to fans who wish to stand, rather than sit at football matches. After the highly successful introduction to rail seating at Celtic Park, as well as numerous Bundesliga clubs, many football fans feel that laws preventing standing areas should be relaxed.
attributes.additional_details:
Some football clubs that already have successfully installed rail seating are: Celtic, Werder Bremen, Hamburg SV, Vfl Wolfsburg, Hannover 96 and the famous “yellow wall” at Borussia Dortmund. 

In conclusion, there is a clear demand for safe standing with 92% of respondents saying fans should be given the choice to stand in safe standing areas, in a poll by the Football Fans Census, and it would only promote English football further by improving the overall matchday experience.

attributes.action: Create a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy
attributes.background: The Bishop's review of Hillsborough families' experiences recommends the creation of a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy. The Government must implement this recommendation. This petition was started by bereaved relatives of family members who perished in the Grenfell Tower fire.
attributes.additional_details: The Charter will include commitments by public bodies to change in relation to transparency and acting in the public interest. By adopting this, the Government will show that it has learned the lessons of the Hillsborough disaster and ensure that the perspective of bereaved families is never lost. We’re concerned that the Grenfell public inquiry isn’t taking into account the views of bereaved families, survivors, and local community affected. They can be spared the indignities, pain and suffering Bishop James Jones describes in his report as "The Patronising disposition of unaccountable power".

attributes.action: Make all supermarkets sell a full comprehensive range of vegan foods and drinks.
attributes.background: More people would go vegan if shopping was easier. This would help our planet and spare the torture of the animals. Make it law for major supermarkets to stock a full range of food and drink alternatives.

attributes.action: Enact New UK Legislation to Ban Food Waste
attributes.background: No country in Europe wastes as much food as the UK, despite millions of children, homeless and vulnerable people sleeping hungry at night. In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. We urge the UK government to enact a similar law.
attributes.additional_details: The £17 billion of food thrown away in the UK (WRAP). In the last 5 years, homelessness has also doubled and three million school children also risk hunger. Inspiringly, France has passed a law to ban food waste with fines and imprisonment for defaulters. In the UK, too, nutritious rescued food can feed the homeless and children in schools. The Government must uphold the right to food for every citizen and urgently pass a strong law to tackle food poverty and food waste.

attributes.action: Make removing items from a grave without permission illegal
attributes.background: We are creating this petition on behalf of all grieving parents and families who would like to decorate their child's grave, without the risk that cemetery staff may remove items without getting  permission from the family.
attributes.additional_details: We lost our baby girl Niamh at 22 weeks and 4 days and wanted to lay her to rest in a place where she wouldn't be disturbed by cemetery staff removing her belongings for health and safety reasons, in case the lawnmower ran the stones over and caused an interference or, in the words of the cemetery manager, "caused a death".

attributes.action: Abolish prescription charges
attributes.background: England is the only part of the UK who still charges prescription charges. Prescription charges make medications unaffordable. The Prescription Charges Coalition found that 1 in 3 people with a long term condition who paid for their medications did not pick up their medication due to costs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.prescriptionchargescoalition.org.uk/uploads/1/2/7/5/12754304/still_paying_the_price_june_2017.pdf
